member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Keys[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Keys that should trigger logging. Pass null for full logging.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.SetWindowsHookEx(System.Int32,VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.HookProc,System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SetWindowsHookEx function installs an application-defined hook procedure into a hook chain. You would install a hook procedure to monitor the system for certain types of events. These events are associated either with a specific thread or with all threads in the same desktop as the calling thread.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the hook procedure.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.UnhookWindowsHookEx(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The UnhookWindowsHookEx function removes a hook procedure installed in a hook chain by the SetWindowsHookEx function.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.CallNextHookEx(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The CallNextHookEx function passes the hook information to the next hook procedure in the current hook chain. A hook procedure can call this function either before or after processing the hook information.
member.param: hook code passed to hook procedure.
W value passed to hook procedure.
L value passed to hook procedure.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is true.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.LowLevelKeyboardInputEvent.VirtualCode
member.summary: A virtual-key code. The code must be a value in the range 1 to 254.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.LowLevelKeyboardInputEvent.Key
member.summary: Gets the VirtualCode converted to typeof(Keys) for higher usability.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.LowLevelKeyboardInputEvent.HardwareScanCode
member.summary: A hardware scan code for the key.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.LowLevelKeyboardInputEvent.Flags
member.summary: The extended-key flag, event-injected Flags, context code, and transition-state flag. This member is specified as follows. An application can use the following values to test the keystroke Flags. Testing LLKHF_INJECTED (bit 4) will tell you whether the event was injected. If it was, then testing LLKHF_LOWER_IL_INJECTED (bit 1) will tell you whether or not the event was injected from a process running at lower integrity level.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.LowLevelKeyboardInputEvent.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time stamp stamp for this message, equivalent to what GetMessageTime would return for this message.

member.name: F:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.LowLevelKeyboardInputEvent.AdditionalInformation
member.summary: Additional information associated with the message.

member.name: P:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHookEventArgs.KeyboardState
member.summary: Gets the state of the keyboard.

member.name: M:VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHookEventArgs.#ctor(VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.LowLevelKeyboardInputEvent,VisioForge.Core.UI.WinForms.Dialogs.GlobalKeyboardHook.KeyboardState)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
